Dear Gordon,

I just checked my disks and they seemed to be fine. Now I am =
running that crawl again and will report if this error can be reproduced. I=
t might take another 24h as I just could start the crawl now.

Cheers,
Tino=


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>=

> The SEVERE errors you're seeing suggest some corruption in the on-disk 
=
> queues such that they don't have the expected structure.
> 
> Most helpfu=
l in understanding what happened would be the very first such 
> WARNING or=
 SEVERE errors in the job.log, and any other errors/exceptions 
> that migh=
t appear at that time or before, in the job.log or 
> heritrix_out.log on d=
isk.
> 
> This could be a new bug, so I'm interested in seeing what other h=
ints 
> are in your logs. However, such corruption could also be triggered =
by a 
> momentary bit of memory or disk/IO corruption, so checking that the=
 
> system is healthy is also appropriate. (Checking system logs, filesyste=
m 
> integrity, or using disk diagnostics like 'SMART' may be helpful.)
> 
=
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> t.schoellhorn wrote:
> > Hi,
> > 
> > currently I am r=
unning a crawl with 500 seeds. After some hours the an error occurs repeate=
dely in the job.log. It occurs that often, so that the job.log gets 500 MB =
big - so I assume that something is seriously wrong here (see attachted job=
.log excerpt). 
> > 
> > As I honestly have no idea what is going on I try =
to attach my crawler-beans.xml so that someone might get an idea what I am =
doing wrong or what is going on.
> > 
> > I'd be glad for any suggestions w=
hat I can try to solve that problem. 
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > Tino
> > 
> >
